website_summaries.verdict: A good budget option that still stands up to the normal abuse fuel filters face during the daily commute.
pros: Compatible with many different types of engines and vehicle models
Despite the budget price, the build quality is good enough to handle more advanced engines such as fuel injection systems
cons: Filter won’t last as long as normal when used in high performance engines

customer_reviews.title: Fast, easy and cheap for less than the price of lunch!
customer_reviews.text: This fits my V6 1999 Chevy Blazer 2-door (2WD) like a glove! Do you have any idea how much the dealer wanted to charge me for the part and labor to do this? Everyone should save money and time and do it themselves. It is VERY easy and your engine will be cleaner and more efficient. This means your engine oil will stay cleaner longer, and your mileage may improve! Just search YouTube for easy and free instructions to Do-It-Yourself! Takes less than 10 minutes if you've never done it before.
customer_reviews.author: Carey Holzman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2000 Chevy S10 2.2L
customer_reviews.text: Great fram quality and value. Fits right into place and no leaks. Easy Peasy, Fram is always my Go To for filtration.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: cheaper than auto zone
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with the price. If you can order ahead and have parts there waiting for you. Do it. I will when I can from now on. Save money and less hassle.
customer_reviews.author: john cunningham

customer_reviews.title: I put this on my Chevy S10 truck and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my Chevy S10 truck and the last one was on the truck for 5 years and about 20,000 miles. I've used and products in the past.

customer_reviews.text: I had this filter installed in a matter of minutes

customer_reviews.title: Fuel Filter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this filter to replace the existing filter because I changed the fuel pump. It installed easily with no leaks. Recommend to all mechanics to replace their fuel filters whenever an in-tank fuel pump is replaced.

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Prefect fit. Replaced it when we replaced a fuel pump.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Cross

customer_reviews.title: Fits like factory filter
customer_reviews.text: Fit like a factory filter and has held up well over the last 10,000 miles. Good for my engine and good for my wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Mccutcheon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I assume it is working perfectly and it was easy to install. The price was right.

customer_reviews.title: want to save on your gas bill
customer_reviews.text: i'm a mechanic i always shop around for good deals and i like to save money on my gas it will make your car or truck run a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: pizzaman

customer_reviews.title: fits
customer_reviews.text: good filter for a good price. cheaper than auto part stores, and will perform the same. you need a special wrench to get both ends off, and if it hasn't been changed in a while the bolted end is very difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Guess it's OK. Outer metal shell had some discoloration on it. Arrived with no red plastic protector on quick connect end and no yellow insert bushing on female wrench end as shown in description. But installed easily with no leaks and stopped the "whine" my fuel pump was making when got below one-quarter tank. Would have given higher rating had it arrived with the plastic protectors on each end as shown in picture. Will probably go with Mann or AC Delco filter next time.
customer_reviews.author: kermit

customer_reviews.title: Right part at the right time
customer_reviews.text: I am glad to be able to order parts from Amazon...I usually save several dollars compared to the local parts store and the free shipping makes it even better.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shanks

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: What can ya say, it is a filter. Works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Don Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Fram fuel filter
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a 94 Corvette...it will not fit a 94 Vette...luckily, I traded it for the right filter in an auto parts section of a large chain.
customer_reviews.author: RMV

customer_reviews.title: Check engine code
customer_reviews.text: This is the correct fuel filter for the year make and model of my truck. The filter is for a Z engine code. I have T engine code so I was not able to use this filter. So verify your engine code.
customer_reviews.author: C. Emerson

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA!!!
customer_reviews.text: Says it is made in china. But says on the filter that it is made in USA!!! Fits my 2003 Chevy S10.
customer_reviews.author: RAIDERHEAD

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in good packaging however
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in good packaging however, it smells like gas and has obvious signs this product was used, it had dirt around the tip guess you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Cholo

product_meta.title: FRAM G8219 In-Line Fuel Filter
product_meta.description: Clean fuel is important because there are small jets and passages in the carburetor and opening in a fuel injector. The fuel filter is responsible for keeping the smaller contaminants in the system out of the engine and other fuel delivery components. On carbureted engines these contaminants can cause clogging of orifices or jets and cause the vehicle to get too much or not enough fuel.
feature_bullets: Changing Fuel filters will improve the engines emission
Changing the fuel filter will also improve the engines performance
Conventional stainless steel and conductive plastic fuel filters to meet the needs of virtually all engine configurations
Accessory filters are also important to your vehicle's performance
